text: I'm glad this song is on the list. Looking back, this was one of the very first songs when I started getting a more refined appreciation for soundtrack music as a kid. I would initiate a battle then wait around for 0:56 to come, and I loved that part

text: I came here in the hopes of news about a new golden sun after truly enjoying the first two, but I only get sad news :(

text: If you were a fan of SNES (or GBA) style RPGs, then Golden Sun is right up your alley! One of my best high school gaming experiences. So nostalgic.

author: notlikeicareaboutyou

text: I hope we get a 4. :( 3 flopped, but the first two are amazing. I love the universe overall. I still think Isaac should replace one of the Fire Emblem swordsmen in Smash Bros too.
author: Austin L

text:
I actually... Well, let's say I liked the games less than everyone else. The game was way too easy (one accidental backtrack = completely overleveled), the statistics were broken (why do a psyenergy attack for 180 points when I have a sword that does 200, and a summon that does 400, both for free), Djinn were really overpowered (on top of hard to organize), and the story was too overwritten. I see how it's a good game, and it could be great if you use only a few Djinn, but I really don't see how it's one of the best RPGs out there. 
But dem graphics. An' dat battle theme.

text: YEAH LOVE THIS SONG

text: This is so Motoi Sakuraba. His style is great and easily recognizable.
author: Hans-Jeiger Gram

text: What other games did he write music for?
author: Naija Player

text:
He's done Baten Kaitos (1 and 2), Eternal Sonata, Dark Souls (1 and 2), and tons more that I don't really know much about. He's got a great alt. rock style, but he's pretty good in other genres too. 

http://sakuraba.snesmusic.org/discography/
author: Hans-Jeiger Gram

text: Awesome, thanks for the info!

text:
This is my absolute favourite JRPG 2-parter ever!
I played this when I started high school, and now I've almost finished. :( My god. The nostalgia! Dark Dawn for me was a half-half but I would LOVE 4th one! Please Camelot!

text: This, the Star Ocean series, and Tales of Phantasia are Motoi Sakuraba in his prime. I'm surprised it wasn't already on the list, but nice add either way! Never stop posting.
author: Nick Roselin Oleksiak

text:
Man, this really takes me back. I probably played through both games like 7 times already. Definitely one of my Top 5 favorite JRPGs, it's was that good.

Too bad Dark Dawn came along and ruined everything, like SupraDarky said.
They tried WAY too hard to be like their precessors, and ruined everything in the process.

text: Greatest RPG ever!

text:
Is this game still worth playing today ?
I'm tempted to buy it on WiiU because it runs like shit on my DS flashcard.
author: Grobzoula

text: Definately! The zelda like puzzles blend perfectly with the RPG elements, The first one is about 20/25 hours of gameplay the sequel finishes the story and is about 2, to 3 times as big! We'll have to wait for it, but it'll come to the VC eventually! It's really worth it if you can still apreciate the graphics (they're gorgeous, for a gba game!)

text: Yes it is, make sure you beat it and get all the Djinn before starting 2

text: Dark Dawn - The puzzles were neat, but the battles were too easy until the last and secret bosses. I also liked how every djinni was unique in appearence.

text: Wow, that's an epic song
author: Momo

text: Dark Dawn was a decent game, it just couldn't live up to its predecessors: two of the best RPGs ever made.
author: Woodo

text: I wouldn't go that far. It was at best mediocre. It was "WORDS WORDS WORDS" the game, the plot was shitted up, the puzzles were casualized and the music was meh.
author: Vidyagamesnake

text: @Videogamesnake Well, that's your opinion. I consider it to be decent.
author: Woodo

text: @***** That's the thing: the first two Golden Sun games were flawless. The music is timeless and the visuals were unreal, especially for games released in the early years of the GBA. Dark Dawn is inferior by comparison, mainly because those first two games were simply unbeatable. Dark Dawn is mediocre compared to those games, but as a DS RPG that stands on its own, it's pretty decent.
author: Woodo

text: I love Golden Sun, thanks for this music
author: spacepirate55

text: While I never played the first one (loved the second) I do think this is an amazing song :D
author: Crux Mar

text: Golden Sun and The Lost Age are fucking amazing. The graphics are the best on the console, the gameplay was superb, the game didn't hold your hand, it was massive and open, had fucking awesome powers, a decent story, perfect music and overall was a masterpiece.
author: Vidyagamesnake

text: I wasn't aware that there were any console versions. I thought they were handheld exclusives.
author: Matt Maberry
garfreeek

text:
@Matt Maberry
Handheld console=console
Didn't need to add handheld because everybody would get this.
Also Wii U VC version.
author: Vidyagamesnake

text: I was under the impression that handhelds and consoles were two completely different items. The overarching category is video game "system". Falling under that classification are " home consoles" and "handheld systems". To say "handheld console" is a contradiction in terms. And I do not count the virtual version because it was not designed specifically for a home console.
author: Matt Maberry

text: @Matt Maberry There are home consoles and handheld consoles. The term "system" also works. No contradiction in calling the GBA a "handheld console".
author: SupraDarky

text: Props to Nintendo for re-releasing this game on Wii U Virtual Console.

text: First game I had on the GBA. I remember opening it on Christmas morning and showing how amazing it looked to my mom. We were both blown away. I absolutely loved this game as a kid. Havent played it since then. I think I'm going to do another play through.
author: Jared Silvestri

text: I was wondering when you'd put this. Smooth McGroove is also awesome. :D
author: electricmastro

text: This is a battle theme that really stuck with me since I played this game more than 10 years ago (wow...). I remember being amazed by this game's graphics and music quality back then. The battle system was highly impressive, especially the variety of summons. After Golden Sun 3 flopped, you have to wonder if we'll ever see a new entry in this series.
author: SupraDarky

text: It feels odd knowing that each game has ended on a cliffhanger. I just want the quest I started back in 2001 have a satisfying conclusion.
author: Edward

text: Yeah, couldn't get through GS3. Man this game was awesome in 2001! Camelot really paid attention to the GBA, unlike too many other "Eh, just port this SNES or Genesis game" shovelware out there.
